metadata.title: CVE-2019-11487 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: The Linux kernel before 5.1-rc5 allows page->_refcount reference countoverflow, with resultant use-after-free issues, if about 140 GiB of RAMexists. This is related to fs/fuse/dev.c, fs/pipe.c, fs/splice.c,include/linux/mm.h, include/linux/pipe_fs_i.h, kernel/trace/trace.c,mm/gup.c, and mm/hugetlb.c. It can occur with FUSE requests.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
